item.description:
The Bioscience Network (TBN) is proud to be an affiliate at Massachusetts Life Sciences Innovation (MALSI) Day 2012: "The Burden of Proof".

 

Mark your calendar for this once-a-year all-day event on May 30, 2012 from 8 AM to 7 PM.

If you can't make the full day conference, register for 5 to 7 PM for cocktails and the culmination of the poster competition.

 

This year's 5th annual MALSI Day will focus on proving technology to investors, regulators and payers by providing what each needs to understand the product's value.

 

Massachusetts Life Sciences Innovation Day "The Burden of Proof" Wednesday, May 30 8 AM to 7 PM at the
Harvard Club of Boston
374 Commonwealth Ave. Boston, MA
REGISTER

Keynote Speaker:

Harvey F. Lodish, PhD

Member, Whitehead Institute for Biomedical Research,

Professor of Biology and Bioengineering, MIT  

 

 "The Burden of Proof" Poster Competition

 

$ CASH PRIZES $


1st Prize - $1000

2nd Prize - $500

3rd Prize - $250

 

Our poster session will showcase fundamental advances in research so they can be seen by a broader audience, to help set the compass for where the industry could go in the future.

5th Annual Massachusetts Life Sciences Innovation (MALSI) Day

 

The biggest day for life sciences in Massachusetts is MAY 30, 2012!

 

MALSI Day is a high-energy, hands-on event for scientific leaders and business experts to mingle with innovators, post-docs, professors, entrepreneurs, and venture capitalists.

 

This year's theme: "The Burden of Proof" Getting a discovery to the market requires inventors and developers to "Prove it!" Scientists have to show that their technology works. The conference this year will focus on how and when to prove your technology and what investors, regulators and payers will need to understand your product's viability and efficacy. _______________________________

 

Panels and Open Discussions will include:

* Panel of CEOs who have recently raised money

* Your data - what is publishable vs. what is commercializable

* Proof of Concept Experiments
* Getting other people to prove it for you
* Killer experiments that Big Pharma wants to see
* How big is your market and does it really exist
* Funding models

______________________________

 

About MALSI

Massachusetts Life Sciences Innovation Day (MALSI) has been developed by the Massachusetts Life Sciences Start-up Initiative. MALSI is a platform organization that brings together all the major public and private entities in Massachusetts that are committed to building the next generation of life science companies. MALSI's mission is to maintain Massachusetts' status as the world leader for supporting life science companies. For Sponsorship Opportunities
Abi Barrow, MTTC, at abarrow@umassp.edu Lauren Laidlaw, MBC, at lauren.laidlaw@massbio.org.      
The Bioscience Network (TBN) is a non-profit organization providing networking and professional growth to individuals in the Biosciences industries. www.thebiosciencenetwork.org
item.name: 5th Annual Massachusetts Life Sciences Innovation (MALSI) Day
